Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SPR-2 (Sushi 1 analog, Arg-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (41.18%) toSushi peptide 1R: 26%; F: 18%; L: 15%; A: 12%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 6.25 uM), A. baumannii (MIC 1 uM), and  S. aureus ATCC 25923 or MRSA (MIC 1-6.25 uM).Structure:  helical in TFE, SDS, LPS, or bacteria.In vitro toxicity: RBC: not hemo-lytic at 50 uM. not toxic to mammalian cells (HMEC-1).Animal model:mouse: increased survival of animals infected with resistant A. baumannii (all died in 24 h without treatment) when IP treated 1 h post infection (~75% survived).
Literature Information.Author: Yang CH, Chen YC, Peng SY, Tsai AP, Lee TJ, Yen JH, Liou JW.2018
Literature Information.Title: An engineered arginine-rich alpha-helical antimicrobial peptide exhibits broad-spectrum bactericidal activity against pathogenic bacteria and reduces bacterial infections in mice
